intro: Scutellaria formosana var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan skullcap, is a perennial herb native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are blue to violet, tubular, and arranged in whorls along the stem. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
